[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@microsoft/api-extractor](./api-extractor.md) &gt; [IConfigApiReport](./api-extractor.iconfigapireport.md) &gt; [tagsToReport](./api-extractor.iconfigapireport.tagstoreport.md)

## IConfigApiReport.tagsToReport property

Specifies a list of [TSDoc](https://tsdoc.org/) tags that should be reported in the API report file for items whose documentation contains them.

**Signature:**

```typescript
tagsToReport?: Readonly<Record<`@${string}`, boolean>>;
```

## Remarks

Tag names must begin with `@`<></>.

This list may include standard TSDoc tags as well as custom ones. For more information on defining custom TSDoc tags, see [here](https://api-extractor.com/pages/configs/tsdoc_json/#defining-your-own-tsdoc-tags)<></>.

Note that an item's release tag will always reported; this behavior cannot be overridden.

## Example 1

Omitting default tags To omit the `@sealed` and `@virtual` tags from API reports, you would specify `tagsToReport` as follows:

```json
"tagsToReport": {
 "@sealed": false,
 "@virtual": false
}
```

## Example 2

Including additional tags To include additional tags to the set included in API reports, you could specify `tagsToReport` like this:

```json
"tagsToReport": {
 "@customTag": true
}
```
This will result in `@customTag` being included in addition to the default tags.
